result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel J Rios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/21/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/21/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, school and child care. 


Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel J Rios

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel J Rios in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Angel J Rios in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 60 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, school and child care. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/21/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/21/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Angel J Rios in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Angel J Rios in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.   Court entered a plea of not guilty.  Defense requests quick date plea.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Quick date was approved by the clerk in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel J Rios in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Angel J Rios in custody.  Dennis Stingl for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, deputy not available to appear for today's proceedings.  Defense objects to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Angel J Rios in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Angel J Rios in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Angel J Rios
Current: 1036 Ontario Ave #A, Sheboygan, WI 50831   (Effective: 03-25-2014)
Prior: 2112 Seamman Avenue, Sheboygan, WI 50831
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Angel J Rios not in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/6/14 @ 1:30pm
